BR_text.BRdescription:
Reading the FAQ: <denchmark-link:https://mindsdb.github.io/mindsdb/docs/faq>https://mindsdb.github.io/mindsdb/docs/faq</denchmark-link>
 
 there is a wrong link to the data sources supported:
 «Currently, we support tabular data, this is CSV, excel, json files and urls or relational data stores. For more information please see the <denchmark-link:https://mindsdb.github.io/docs/DataSources>data sources documentation</denchmark-link>
 »
 <denchmark-link:https://mindsdb.github.io/docs/DataSources>https://mindsdb.github.io/docs/DataSources</denchmark-link>
 
 404
 There isn't a GitHub Pages site here.

comments_0.comment_text:
I am not sure if you want this kind of issues to be reported here. I have found also some obsolete doc in places like:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/acs/mindsdb/tree/master/mindsdb/libs>https://github.com/acs/mindsdb/tree/master/mindsdb/libs</denchmark-link>
 
 It is a good intention to try to document folders source code contents but at the end, it always get out of sync with the source code, so probably it is better to just remove this kind of doc IMHO. And try to have the doc inside the code.

comments_1.comment_text:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/acs>@acs</denchmark-link>
  and thanks for reporting the docs link issue.
